$description: Core spacing primitives defining the spatial system. Based on a 4px/0.25rem base unit for consistency. Use spacing tokens for margins, paddings, and gaps. RULE: Always use spacing tokens instead of arbitrary values to maintain visual rhythm and consistency across the UI.

spacing.$description: Component-level spacing scale for padding, margins, and gaps. Follows a non-linear scale optimized for common UI patterns. Use 2xs-xs for ultra-compact/tight UIs, sm for compact UIs, md for default spacing, lg-xl for breathing room, 2xl for maximum section separation.

2xs.$description: spacing.2xs — 2x extra small spacing (8px). Use for: minimal internal padding, tight icon gaps, ultra-compact components, subtle spacing between inline elements.

xs.$description: spacing.xs — Extra small spacing (10px). Use for: tight padding in compact components, icon-to-text gaps, inline element spacing, dense data tables.

sm.$description: spacing.sm — Small spacing (12px). Use for: standard component internal padding, form field padding, list item padding, card content padding.

md.$description: spacing.md — Medium spacing (16px). DEFAULT spacing value. Use for: standard gaps between elements, modal padding, card padding, section padding within components.

lg.$description: spacing.lg — Large spacing (20px). Use for: generous padding, separation between related groups, dialog/modal padding, card spacing.

xl.$description: spacing.xl — Extra large spacing (32px). Use for: major section separation, page-level margins, large component padding, hero sections.

2xl.$description: spacing.2xl — 2x extra large spacing (40px). Use for: maximum section separation, page-level padding, large hero spacing, full-width container margins.

gridSpacing.$description: Grid and layout gutter spacing based on 8px grid. Use for CSS Grid gap, Flexbox gap, and multi-column layout gutters. Pixel values for precise grid alignment. All values are multiples of 8px.

xs.$description: gridSpacing.xs — Extra small grid gap (8px). Use for: compact card grids, dense dashboard layouts, mobile-optimized grids, icon grids.

sm.$description: gridSpacing.sm — Small grid gap (16px). Use for: standard card grids, form layouts, compact dashboard grids.

md.$description: gridSpacing.md — Medium grid gap (24px). Use for: default content grids, spacious card layouts, comfortable dashboard grids.

lg.$description: gridSpacing.lg — Large grid gap (32px). Use for: spacious card layouts, content grids, marketing pages.

xl.$description: gridSpacing.xl — Extra large grid gap (40px). Use for: hero grids, feature showcases, landing page layouts.

2xl.$description: gridSpacing.2xl — 2x extra large grid gap (48px). Use for: maximum separation in grids, presentation layouts, sparse artistic layouts.

verticalRhythm.$description: Baseline-aligned spacing for vertical rhythm in typography-heavy layouts. Based on 1.6rem (25.6px) baseline. Use for consistent vertical spacing in prose content, documentation, and text-heavy interfaces. Maintains readable flow in long-form content.

xs.$description: verticalRhythm.xs — Quarter baseline (6.4px). Use for: list item spacing within tight lists, line spacing adjustments, micro-spacing in prose.

sm.$description: verticalRhythm.sm — Half baseline (12.8px). Use for: heading bottom margins, spacing after inline elements, paragraph-adjacent element spacing.

md.$description: verticalRhythm.md — Single baseline (25.6px). DEFAULT prose spacing. Use for: paragraph margins, standard content block spacing, default vertical rhythm.

lg.$description: verticalRhythm.lg — 1.5 baselines (38.4px). Use for: heading top margins, spacing before new sections within content, emphasis breaks.

xl.$description: verticalRhythm.xl — Double baseline (51.2px). Use for: major section breaks in prose, chapter-level separations, significant content divisions.

2xl.$description: verticalRhythm.2xl — Triple baseline (76.8px). Use for: page section breaks, major content area separations, hero-to-content transitions.
